title: Jeffry.in
description: Jeff Wainwright's blog about software engineering, life, and everything in between.

items.title: Being a US-based Software Engineer in 2025; is it what it used to be?
items.summary: The quick article provides a data-driven look at US-based software engineering employment trends in 2025: relating current swe trends, recent swe trends, pre-covid, and US job labor trends over the last 45 years.

items.title: Shiki Syntax Highlighting: More features for markdown
items.summary: Comprehensive Shiki syntax highlighting implementation with custom themes, diff notation, line highlighting, focus modes, error annotations, interactive copy buttons, and optimized Sass architecture using a scalable variable system.

items.title: Enabling Intelligent Tab Completion in Zsh without High Memory Usage
items.summary: This post provides quick tips on how to enable Zsh Tab Completion to provide intelligent completion in Zsh without the bloat.

items.title: Quick Thought: Does it feel like JavaScript and Node are in a strange place?
items.summary: It feels sorta like JavaScript and Node are in a weird place. They've greatly improved but are we using them for things we shouldn't?

items.title: Quick Tutorial: Build A Basic Dependency Manager Like Dependabot In 5 Minutes
items.summary: This document goes over building the basics of your own dependency manager, like dependabot, for JavaScript ot Typescript using package managers and Github actions.

items.title: Quick Tutorial: Run Intel Mac Cmds On Your M1 Mac Like a Boss In 5 Minutes
items.summary: This document describes solving M1 Mac vs Intel Mac terminal command discrepancies by creating a copy of your terminal and setting it up to run Intel Mac terminal commands using Rosetta.

items.title: A 'little deep' dive into Dependabot and Snyk Ingore Configs
items.summary: This article focuses on Snyk and Dependabots' ignore configs (ignores) from a DevX perspective.

items.title: Document Cookies Are a Useful Tool With A Simple API With Some Nunaces
items.summary: This brief artice covers nuances of document.cookie and how to use it to store and access data.

items.title: Understanding the basics parts of a CLI command
items.summary: This brief article digs into the basics of most CLI commands including a summary of the commands's name, arguments, options, and actions.

items.title: Setting update Gatsby Development on an M1 Mac Mini
items.summary: A post providing context into setting up an M1 Mac for Gatsby development and 1 happy path to get up and running with Gatsby on a M1 Mac fast!

items.title: How To Execute Node Commands To Test With Jest
items.summary: This post is a quick summary of running node script execution tests with Jest.

items.title: Friction and the Beauty it can create
items.summary: Friction sculpted this range of land. What devastation?‚ÄîWhat destruction led to this moment? I cannot even comprehend! But, I appreciate that somehow, after it all, it is so beautiful.

items.title: The 2000s are no longer a teenager, starting out 2020
items.summary: This post summarizes my first days of 2020 with brief reflections on 2019, what I learned which included Functional Programming, TypeScript, nervous system healing and awareness

items.title: Watching the sunset from Malaga Cove, waiting for ships to come in
items.summary: Malaga Cove in Palos Verdes, California is a great spot to catch the sunset. At sunset, it's a place were families, couples, and sometimes dreamers go to watch the sunset. At sunset on Sunday, I watched one particular person stare longly against the sunset. It appeared they were waiting for their ships to come in.

items.title: Listening to what is most important to others is hard. What if there was a highlighter for spoken words?
items.summary: This post discusses how hard it for listeners to fully understand what a speaker is communicating. Misinterpretation happens often. What verbal tools can be used to improve interpretation? Perhaps, imagining a spoken word highlighter pen so that speakers could highlight their key points could help.

items.title: Let the dream live! Unless dreams have actionable plans, they're not real‚Äîso let them live if they bring happiness.
items.summary: Pragmatism has often told me that dreams cannot become real unless they're followed by an actionable plan. I've share this logic with friends when they tell me an unrealistic dream and to my surprise, 'thanks' was not the typical response. Responses tended to be negative. Dreams are often just that, dreams. Let then live if they make others happy.

items.title: Moments Between Words‚ÄîSimple Communication and Observations of Quick Ways To Make Others Feel Good
items.summary: This post observes how different communication can be from intent to reception. It focuses on observations on simple comunications.

items.title: TypeScript Init‚ÄîGetting A Test Driven TypeScript Repository Setup
items.summary: This post documents getting setup with TypeScript‚Äîjust beyond the Gettings Started TypeScript Tutorials. In this Post I will go through setting up a Test Driven TypeScript project.

items.title: First Post in Bit, This Is Why
items.summary: I stopped posting on this blog in September last year, 2017. It was an easy decision to make then. There were specific reasons I stopped, but I couldn't articulate them.
